intro: Kokoona lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf kokoona, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, storing water to help it survive in harsh environments. Kokoona lanceolata produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming during the cooler months.
